business.headline: India's retail inflation dips to 4.31% in January, hits a five-month lowThe country's retail inflation witnessed a drop in January majorly due to declining food prices, according to data released by the National Statistics Office on Wednesday.

Sensex, Nifty recover sharply but end in red; M&M falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 122.52 points lower at 76,171.08. Earlier in the day, the 30-share index had plunged 850 points. Nifty, too, recovered strongly to end 26.55 points lower at 23,045.25.

Mutual fund inflows see slight dip in January. Here's whyThe flows declined 3.6% month-on-month to 396.88 billion rupees ($4.57 billion) from 411.56 billion rupees in December 2024, according to data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

New Income Tax Bill to introduce simpler 'tax year' concept: All you need to knowWhen the Income Tax Act of 1961 came into being it had 880 pages. Over the years, the act contained several amendments introduced in the various budgets.

Stock market bloodbath: Should buy the dip, exit or stay invested? The stock market correction has particularly hit retail investors, many of whom are contemplating selling their holdings at a loss. But is that the right move?

After 90-hour workweek remark, L&T chief stirs work-from-home debateThis is not the first time that the L&T Chairman's remarks have sparked a debate.  Earlier, he advocated a 90-hour workweek, which drew huge criticism.

Will retail inflation cool down further in January? Here's all you need to know The RBI mentioned continued reduction in rice prices and sharp corrections in the prices of vegetables, especially in the prices of onions, potatoes and tomatoes, in its January 2025 Bulletin.

L&T chief stirs fresh row with remark on labour crisis: Workers unwilling to moveSpeaking at CII's Mystic South Global Linkages Summit 2025 in Chennai, Subrahmanyan spoke about the difficulties faced by the construction industry in hiring and mobilising workers.

Sensex falls 700 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged over 850 points before trimming some losses, trading 748.13 points lower at 75,545.47 by 10:23 am. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped nearly 1%, reflecting weakness across broader markets.
Sensex tumbles over 850 points as US tariff fears spook Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex nosedived 834.39 points to 75,459.21 at 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 251.95  points to trade at 22,819.85.

Madhya Pradesh: Rs 1,553 crore for Ladli Behna Yojana released. Check eligibilityLadli Behna Yojana aims to improve women's well-being, health, nutrition and economic independence. Presently, Rs 1,250 per month is given to all the eligible women under this scheme.

8th Pay Commission: Will its implementation face delays?Despite several measures announced for taxpayers in the Union Budget 2025, there was no mention of the financial impact of implementing the 8th Pay Commission.

Are you eligible for fixed medical allowance under NPS? Check details Retired central government civilian employees who are covered under the National Pension System will now be eligible for fixed medical allowance, announced the Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare.

Sensex ends 1,000 points lower: 5 factors behind today's stock market crashInvestors lost nearly Rs 10 lakh crore as selling pressure intensified across sectors due to various factors that dampened investor sentiment.

Sensex falls 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 10 lakh crore on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked by 1,1018.20 points to end at 76,293.60, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 309.80 points to close at 23,071.80.

India's inflation likely to dip to a 5-month low of 4.60% in January: ReportThe country's consumer inflation is expected to fall to a five-month low of 4.60% in January 2025, as compared to 5.22% which was recorded in December last year, as per Reuters.

India to keep ban on Chinese investments for now, says Chief Economic AdviserSpeaking at an event in Mumbai on Tuesday, Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V. Anantha Nageswaran said that any changes to the current restrictions would take time and require a deeper understanding between both countries.

Coimbatore company rewards employees with Rs 14.5 crore bonus. Here's whyA few days ago, the CEO, Saravana Kumar, formally announced the release of the bonus. He shared that he deliberately did not choose to offer employee stock options (ESOPS) or performance-based incentives.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia critisises Aadhaar and UPI in a podcast Sabeer Bhatia mentioned that the use of video and voiceprint technology for the Aadhaar project, which is already embedded in smartphones, could have been a better approach which could have achieved the same results at much lower costs.

Not Mumbai or Bengaluru, this Indian city leads in luxury home price surgeMumbai, traditionally known for its expensive real estate, was placed seventh in the global rankings for luxury home price surge.

entertainment.headline: Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show is the most-watchedRapper Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show has become the most-watched Super Bowl show of all time, garnering an impressive 133.5 million views.

Too much to handle: Samay Raina deletes all videos from his show amid jokes rowComedian Samay Raina finally broke his silence on the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's remark on his show, India's Got Latent. He has confirmed deleting all the videos of the show, and also added that whatever is happening right now is too much for him to handle.

Amy Adams joins Javier Bardem in Cape Fear TV adaptationAfter Javier Bardem, actor Amy Adams is on board for the much-awaited Cape Fear TV adaptation. The release date for the show has not been announced yet.

Kanye West dropped by talent agency amid antisemitic, controversial actionsKanye West's controversial actions have led to his talent agency, 33&West, dropping him. The decision follows a series of antisemitic remarks and troubling social media posts by the rapper that have sparked widespread condemnation.

Samay Raina's show in Gujarat cancelled amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina's Gujarat shows have been cancelled following a controversy sparked by the latest episode of his show, India's Got Latent. The decision comes amid backlash after a distasteful comment by YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia on the show.

Sakamoto Days: With ex-assassin's potential match, the anime is raising stakesSakamoto Days follows the story of a legendary assassin who transforms into a family man. Now, with the introduction of an equally formidable enemy, the anime might finally pick up pace and raise the stake.
Aashram 3 Part 2 teaser: Bobby Deol's comeback as Baba Nirala promises more twistsAashram 3 Part 2 teaser is out. The upcoming riveting crime drama marks the return of Bobby Deol as Bala Nirala.

Anupamaa actor Gaurav Khanna opens up on being colour-blind on Celebrity MasterchefTV actor Gaurav Khanna appeared on Celebrity MasterChef where he opened up about being colour-blind. He participated on the show along with Ayesha Jhulka.

BTS' V named world's most handsome man. Hrithik Roshan, Brad Pitt also on listBTS singer V aka Kim Taehyung has been named as the world's most handsome man. The list also features Indian actor Hrithik Roshan, Hollywood stars Brad Pitt, Tom Cruise, Bradley Cooper, among others.

Picture This trailer: Simone Ashley, Hero Fiennes to headline new romantic comedyThe trailer for Simone Ashley and Hero Fiennes Tiffin's film, Picture This, has been unveiled. It will release on Prime Video on March 6.

Jackson Wang announces MAGIC MAN 2 – A raw and vulnerable chapterJackson Wang is set to release MAGIC MAN 2, an album that delves into the stages of grief and personal growth. After a year of introspection, he presents a raw and authentic portrayal of his journey.

Pop girl group XG take their 'The first HOWL' World Tour to Latin-America  XG, a dynamic hip-hop/R&B-inspired girl group, is set to captivate audiences in Latin America with their inaugural concerts in Brazil and Mexico. As they continue their world tour, XG unveils a groundbreaking project, 'XDM Unidentified Waves,' that redefines their music and solidifies their global appeal.

Singer Liam Payne was struggling with sexuality, coerced ex to abort: ReportA new report reveals late One Direction star Liam Payne struggled with his sexuality and allegedly pressured ex-fiancée Maya Henry to terminate a pregnancy.

Mukesh Khanna on Ranveer Allahbadia row: Blacken his faceActor Mukesh Khanna has criticised YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia for making explicit remarks on Samay Raina's show, calling for strict punishment to deter such behaviour.

Munawar Faruqui to Vir Das, comedians who landed in trouble for inappropriate jokesAs podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his obscene jokes on an episode of India's Got Latent, here's a look at other stand-up comedians who have found themselves in trouble.

Diddy allegedly 'drugged and raped' a man, claims new lawsuitMusic mogul Sean Combs is embroiled in fresh legal trouble as an anonymous plaintiff files a sexual assault lawsuit against him in New York.

The phone dropped...: Story of Jitendra Kumar's humility and unassuming successActor Jitendra Kumar, popularly known as Jeetu Bhaiya, says the bigger thing is not to decide whether to take a risk in life or not, but to know what is at stake.

Arunachal women panel condemns Elvish Yadav's 'racist' remarks against Chum DarangThe Arunachal Pradesh State Commission for Women has condemned Elvish Yadav's derogatory remarks against Chum Darang and has demanded strict action. The comments have sparked backlash.

Kadhalikka Neramillai: Nithya Menen, Ravi Mohan's rom-com now streaming on NetflixKadhalikka Neramillai, the heartfelt romantic film, starring Nithya Menen and Ravi Mohan is streaming on OTT. The Tamil film had its theatrical release on January 14.

Suzhal The Vortex Season 2 to premiere on Prime Video this monthA brand-new season of the Tamil Prime Video series, Suzhal: The Vortex, was announced on Tuesday. The show will begin streaming on the OTT platform from this month itself.

general news.headline: NDA '300 paar' if Lok Sabha polls were held today, Congress slips: MOTN pollThe Mood of the Nation opinion poll shows that the Congress-led INDIA bloc, which punched above its weight to win 232 seats in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, will be down to 188 if the elections are held today.
Trump discusses ending Ukraine war with Putin: To begin by calling ZelenskyyDonald Trump said he spoke with Putin about starting negotiations immediately to end the war in Ukraine.

Too much to handle: Samay Raina deletes all videos from his show amid jokes rowComedian Samay Raina finally broke his silence on the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's remark on his show, India's Got Latent. He has confirmed deleting all the videos of the show, and also added that whatever is happening right now is too much for him to handle.

MOTN poll shows Tamil Nadu still out of reach for BJP. Will 'grand alliance' help?MOTN poll: The BJP failed to breach the southern fortress of Tamil Nadu in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls despite its state president Annamalai running an energetic campaign.

AAP's Saurabh Bhardwaj turns Berozgar YouTuber after polls lossAfter losing the Greater Kailash seat in the 2025 Delhi Assembly election, former minister Saurabh Bhardwaj has turned to YouTube. The AAP leader, who was elected from GK thrice, posted a video on his YouTube channel, Berozgar Neta, saying the loss flipped his life by 180 degrees. He has promised to discuss new topics daily.

Shubman stars as India warm up to Champions Trophy with 3-0 sweep vs EnglandShubman Gill's execellent hundred and a complete bowling performance helped India clean sweep the ODI series against England. The Jos Buttler's side failed to put up any resistance in Ahmedabad, losing the final match by 142 runs.

US Senate confirms Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligenceThe Senate voted 52 to 48, mostly along party lines, to confirm Tulsi Gabbard to the position overseeing the 18-agency intelligence community and acting as Donald Trump's top adviser on intelligence issues.

Advantage NDA in Bihar if alliance stays together, suggests Mood of the Nation pollThe BJP-led NDA is projected to win 33-35 of Bihar's 40 Lok Sabha seats if elections were held today, while the opposition 'mahagathbandhan' may secure only 5-7, according to the Mood of the Nation survey.

44% see positive impact of Donald Trump 2.0 on India: Mood of the Nation pollThe Mood of the Nation opinion poll shows while 13% felt that the Donald Trump administration was 'very good' for India, 7% felt that it would be 'disastrous.'

NDA comeback in Uttar Pradesh after 2024 upset, suggests Mood of the Nation pollThe India Today-Cvoter Mood of the Nation (MOTN) poll showed a 4 per cent increase in NDA's vote share as compared to the 2024 Lok Sabha election.

Video: Emmanuel Macron's 'namaste' to PM Modi as he sees him off in MarseilleFrench President Emmanuel Macron bid farewell to Prime Minister Narendra Modi with a traditional 'namaste' as the latter concluded his three-day visit and departed for the United States from Marseille. At the airport in Marseille, the two leaders shared a warm hug before the Prime Minister embarked on the second leg of his journey to Washington, DC.

Why chai-samosa won't go easy on your pocket at the airportCould the government intervene? Certainly. Would it? Unlikely. The 'argument': airports are commercial spaces where businesses can freely charge what the market can bear

How College Romance could bail out Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay RainaComics and YouTubers, including Ranveer Allahbadia and Samay Raina, have been booked in two states and charged with obscenity. In this context, it is interesting to revisit a Supreme Court verdict of March 2024 in the College Romance case. In that case, the SC made a clear distinction between obscenity and obscene language.

How will India navigate trade in the Trump 2.0 era?PM Modi's visit may ease tensions, but a lasting solution remains uncertain. With billions in trade at risk, the coming months will test US-India relations in a high-stakes economic standoff.

Aren't we creating class of parasites? Supreme Court frowns on poll freebiesThe Supreme Court's strong observation comes at a time when political parties go all out to woo voters by promising freebies with little concern for state finances.

Jam-packed highways and streets: Satellite pics show maha traffic at Maha KumbhThousands of people were left stranded in their vehicles as traffic jams stretched for several kilometres on roads in Prayagraj and national highways last weekend.

PM Modi visits ITER in France, a nuclear facility replicating the sunPM Modi was joined by French President Emmanuel Macron on the visit as the two leaders met and interacted with scientists, engineers of the facility.

Indians seeking asylum in US grew 470% in 5 years: StudyIndians seeking asylum in the US grew from 9,000 in 2018 to 51,000 in 2023, a 466% rise in 5 years, shows a study by researchers from Johns Hopkins University. However, going by US government data, the number of undocumented Indians in the US dipped by 60% in 2022 since the peak in 2016.

His Delhi politics: Uddhav Sena fumes as Sharad Pawar felicitates Eknath ShindeNCP founder Sharad Pawar had a rare praise for Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister and Shiv Sena chief Eknath Shinde, complimenting his inclusive approach to governance. However, the Shiv Sena (UBT) is said to be upset over Pawar's gesture.

Modi, Trump set for bonhomie, and hard defence bargainingIndia's defence acquisition wishlist is nothing short of ambitious as it accelerates military modernisation to become a self-reliant power in the polarised world

Dayanand Saraswati and the temple rat that led to the birth of Arya SamajDayanand Saraswati was a devout Shiva worshipper, but a temple incident led him to reject idol worship early on, and go on a mission to transform Hinduism, ultimate founding the Arya Samaj and bringing in a hoard of reforms across India.

India among 100 most corrupt countries in the world. Check list and rankingSharing the spot with Gambia and Maldives, India is amongst the 100 most corrupt countries in the world, a recent report revealed.

Ex-President Pranab Mukherjee's son Abhijit rejoins Congress: Coming back homeAbhijit Mukherjee, son of former President Pranab Mukherjee, who had left the Congress in 2021, rejoined the party on Wednesday.

Ranveer Allahbadia's rumoured girlfriend shares cryptic post amid breakup buzzThe internet is buzzing with speculation that Ranveer Allahbadia and his rumoured girlfriend, Nikki Sharma, have called it quits.

Director Ahmed Khan admits Akshay Kumar reads his lines from teleprompterAkshay Kumar has been criticised for using a teleprompter instead of memorising his lines. Director Ahmed Khan agreed to it, but defended the actor's method.

Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show is the most-watchedRapper Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show has become the most-watched Super Bowl show of all time, garnering an impressive 133.5 million views.

Vicky Kaushal calls wife Katrina Kaif 'vichitra prani' in adorable videoKatrina Kaif recently shared a delightful video of Vicky Kaushal on Instagram, captioned with his affectionate words for her. The video comes as Vicky is busy promoting his upcoming film 'Chhaava'.

F1 teaser: Brad Pitt promises an exciting summer with sports filmHollywood star Brad Pitt stars in the thrilling promo of the sports film, F1. The short clip sees Pitt racing against time to make it to the finish line.

sports.headline: Don't judge Shubman Gill after every innings: Gautam GambhirAfter Shubman Gill's incredible ODI series against England, India head coach Gautam Gambhir requested the fans to not judge young players after every innings. Gambhir has said that Gill could become a great batter in the next few years if backed in the ODI and the Test format.

One of my better knocks: Gill happy with century on 'tricky' Ahmedabad pitchIND vs ENG: Shubman Gill scored 112 runs off 102 balls with 14 fours and three sixes as India beat England by 142 runs on Wednesday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

KL Rahul is India's No. 1 keeper, Rishabh Pant will get his chance: GambhirIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has called KL Rahul India's number one wicketkeeper ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. He also said that Rishabh Pant will get his chances.

RCB to announce captain on Feb 13: Is Virat Kohli taking up role? IPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) are all set to announce their new captain for the upcoming edition. After Faf du Plessis was released, RCB need a new skipper to take over from the South African.

Watch: England's snoozefest in Ahmedabad puts Jofra Archer to sleep in dugoutIndia vs England: England fast bowler Jofra Archer fell asleep in the dugout during England's batting in the 3rd ODI match on Wednesday. England failed to turn up with the bat and lost the game by 142 runs.

KL Rahul should not be wasted at No.6: Parthiv Patel after rapid Ahmedabad cameoIndia batter KL Rahul returned to his preferred No.5 position in the 3rd ODI against England. Rahul scored a quickfire 40 runs off 29 balls, helping India post a total of 356 runs.

One net practice on entire tour: Shastri blasts England over 'unserious approach'Former India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri blasted England for not holding enough practice sessions on the tour of India. Kevin Pietersen also lashed out at England side for the same issue.

Shubman stars as India warm up to Champions Trophy with 3-0 sweep vs EnglandShubman Gill's execellent hundred and a complete bowling performance helped India clean sweep the ODI series against England. The Jos Buttler's side failed to put up any resistance in Ahmedabad, losing the final match by 142 runs.

Pietersen dissects Kohli's troubles vs Rashid: Shouldn't be getting out like thatFormer England cricketer Kevin Pietersen shared his views on star India batter Virat Kohli's dismissals against Adil Rashid. Kohli was dismissed by Rashid for the 11th time in international cricket during third ODI.

Kerala set up semi-final clash with Gujarat after 1-run lead vs J&KRanji Trophy: Kerala made their way through to the semi-final after taking a first innings lead in their quarterfinal against Jammu & Kashmir. Kerala will now be up against Gujarat in the semis.

Sachin Yadav, 25, wins javelin gold in National Games with personal best throw25-year-old Sachin Yadav broke the National Games record, winning the gold in men's javelin event in Dehardun on Wednesday. Sachin achieved a new personal best of 84.39m to win the top prize.

One net practice on entire tour: Shastri blasts England over 'unserious approach'Former India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri blasted England for not holding enough practice sessions on the tour of India. Kevin Pietersen also lashed out at England side for the same issue.

Shubman stars as India warm up to Champions Trophy with 3-0 sweep vs EnglandShubman Gill's execellent hundred and a complete bowling performance helped India clean sweep the ODI series against England. The Jos Buttler's side failed to put up any resistance in Ahmedabad, losing the final match by 142 runs.

Pietersen dissects Kohli's troubles vs Rashid: Shouldn't be getting out like thatFormer England cricketer Kevin Pietersen shared his views on star India batter Virat Kohli's dismissals against Adil Rashid. Kohli was dismissed by Rashid for the 11th time in international cricket during third ODI.

Kerala set up semi-final clash with Gujarat after 1-run lead vs J&KRanji Trophy: Kerala made their way through to the semi-final after taking a first innings lead in their quarterfinal against Jammu & Kashmir. Kerala will now be up against Gujarat in the semis.

Sachin Yadav, 25, wins javelin gold in National Games with personal best throw25-year-old Sachin Yadav broke the National Games record, winning the gold in men's javelin event in Dehardun on Wednesday. Sachin achieved a new personal best of 84.39m to win the top prize.

Parthiv Patel names his dark horse for Champions Trophy: They can surprise everyoneFormer India wicketkeeper batter Parthiv Patel predicted four semi-finalists for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025 along with Kevin Pietersen. Patel also named his dark horse for the event.

Watch: Shaheen Afridi, Breetzke involve in heated exchange after mid-pitch collision Star Pakistan fast bowler got involved in a heated exchange with Matthew Breetzke following a mid-pitch collision between the two during the third match of the tri series in Karachi.

Have India read the pitch wrong? Former selector rues lack of spinners in squadIndia have named 5 spinners their Champions Trophy squad. Given that India will play all of their matches in Dubai, a former selector feels that India might have read the pitch conditions wrong for the ICC tournament.

1st ODI: Asalanka, spinners hand Australia reality check before Champions TrophySri Lanka (SL) vs Australia (AUS), 1st ODI: Chairth Asalanka's sensational hundred helped Sri Lanka recover from 55 for 5 and post 214 in Colombo. Australia, without an array of their A-listers, were undone by the Sri Lankan spin-bowling unit.

Shreyas Iyer continues to own no 4 spot, hammers 64-ball 78 vs England in 3rd ODIStar India batter Shreyas Iyer continued his prolific run at number four spot as he slammed a 64-ball 78 against England during the third ODI in Ahmedabad.

Shubman Gill completes 3-peat in Ahmedabad, joins Babar Azam in rare listShubman Gill continued his form with a stunning century in Ahmedabad on Wednesday, February 12. Gill became the first Indian player to hit centuries in all formats of the game at a single venue.

IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill continues Ahmedabad golden run with 95-ball hundredShubman Gill continued his fine form at the Narendra Modi stadium as he scored a 95-ball hundred. This was Gill's first hundred in the ODI format at the ground as he gave India the upper hand in the game.

Virat Kohli's woes against Adil Rashid continue, falls for 11th time vs spinnerStar India batter Virat Kohli was once again dismissed by Adil Rashid in the third ODI against England at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. It was the 11th time in international cricket that Rashid dismissed Kohli.

Shreyas Iyer continues to own no 4 spot, hammers 64-ball 78 vs England in 3rd ODIStar India batter Shreyas Iyer continued his prolific run at number four spot as he slammed a 64-ball 78 against England during the third ODI in Ahmedabad.

Shubman Gill completes 3-peat in Ahmedabad, joins Babar Azam in rare listShubman Gill continued his form with a stunning century in Ahmedabad on Wednesday, February 12. Gill became the first Indian player to hit centuries in all formats of the game at a single venue.

IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill continues Ahmedabad golden run with 95-ball hundredShubman Gill continued his fine form at the Narendra Modi stadium as he scored a 95-ball hundred. This was Gill's first hundred in the ODI format at the ground as he gave India the upper hand in the game.

Virat Kohli's woes against Adil Rashid continue, falls for 11th time vs spinnerStar India batter Virat Kohli was once again dismissed by Adil Rashid in the third ODI against England at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. It was the 11th time in international cricket that Rashid dismissed Kohli.

Virat Kohli, RCB teammate Livingstone engage in banter after LBW reprieveIndia vs England, 3rd ODI: Virat Kohli and Liam Livingstone were involved in banter after a close LBW call went in the India batter's favour. Kohli hit a fifty in the third ODI in Ahmedabad on Wednesday.

IND vs ENG: Rohit Sharma fails in Ahmedabad ODI after hundred in CuttackRohit Sharma's hopes of carrying his form from the Cuttack ODI was ended by Mark Wood as the England pacer dismissed the Indian captain for just 1 run in Ahmedabad on February 12. Rohit scored a hundred in the second ODI in Cuttack.

In-form Shubman Gill closes in on No.1 ODI spot, Virat slips to No.6The latest ICC Rankings saw four India batters make their way into the top 10 in the ODI rankings. India vice-captain Shubman Gill closed in on the No.1 spot.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
